instructions:
Add all above seasonings to a small bowl and whisk until well blended. Curl steak tails and skewer with
toothpicks. Place salmon steaks in a shallow dish and pour marinade over. Cover and refrigerate 3 hours
turning steaks at least once. Place steaks on a broiler pan, baste with marinade and broil 3 inches from heat.
For 1 inch steaks broil 6 minutes on first side, then turn, baste with marinade and broil for about 4 1/2
minutes on second side. Serve with hot melted herbed butter in a small dipping dish and a lemon wedge on
the side. *(For fillets more than ¾ inch thick, broil skin side up for first half.)*

HERBED BUTTER
1/2 cup butter or margarine, softened
1/2 lemon peel, grated
1 tbsp lemon juice
1 tbsp parsley, chopped
1 tbsp fresh herbs *(mix basil, tarragon and/or rosemary)*
1/4 tsp seasoned salt
1/8 tsp white pepper

Herbed butter may be prepared ahead of time by mixing above ingredients. *(If any remains save and use
on cooked carrots.)*

VARIATION:
TERIYAKI MARINATED SALMON STEAKS
Using the teriyaki marinade from "Chicken Teriyaki", marinate the salmon steaks for 3 hours in the
refrigerator and then at room temperature for 30 minutes. Broil as instructed above, basting with the
marinade on top surfaces before placing under broiler. Prepare the herbed butter as above and serve as a hot
dipping sauce.
name: Salmon Steaks With Herbed Butter
creator: Jim Decker
